str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To call in (to my house), invite. From eis and kaleo; to invite in.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I entertain a stranger, (b) I startle, bewilder. From xenos; to be a host; by implication, be strange.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Tomorrow. From epi and aurion; occurring on the succeeding day, i.e. to-morrow.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From sun and erchomai; to convene, depart in company with, associate with, or, cohabit.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Joppa, a coast town of Judea, west-north-west of Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Joppe, a place in Palestine.
